items.item_text_raw: 1. 4:30 p.m. - The Meeting was called to Order at the District Board Room, 40 South Market Street, San Jose, CA 95113

items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.
items.item_text: Information was provided on Public Comments and Disability Access.

items.item_details:
1. Evergreen Valley College Adjunct Faculty
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the AFT 6157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Article 9.13 submission and recommendation:
Article 9.13 ASSIGNMENT LENGTH AND MAXIMUM LOADING - Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all District assigned service during the college semester for which they are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of a full load.
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 9.13 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
				 
A-EVC Adjunct Faculty March 10, 2015

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. Board Policy 6100 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval. All contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions exceeding the current bid limit of $86,000 shall have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts, although not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts, purchase orders and contract revisions for the period of January 10, 2015 through February 9, 2015 as noted in the attached documents.
items.item_text: Ratification of Contracts, Purchase Orders and Contract Revisions
items.item_text_raw: 10. Ratification of Contracts, Purchase Orders and Contract Revisions

items.item_details:
The proposed courses have been reviewed by the appropriate instructional administrator and approved by the All-College Curriculum Committee, acting on behalf of the Academic Senate.  The rigor of the approval process assures that each new course has substance and integrity in relation to its discipline and that they fill a clear student need not being served by existing course offerings.  The new courses are:
	 
PED 039B:  Hatha Yoga - Intermediate
ENGL 032:  Gender in Literature
EDIT 026:  Women in STEM

items.item_details: On April 13, 2015, the Berryessa Citizens Advisory Council will announce the recipient of the Citizen of the Year award for 2014. At the March 11, 2014, Governing Board Meeting, Trustee Rudy Nasol requested, and the Board approved, a recognition certificate to the recipient of this award for 2013. Trustee Nasol is requesting similar approve for the Citizen of the Year award for 2014. Since the award is confidential until the time of the ceremony, the name will be added to this agenda on April 14, 2015. However, Trustee Rudy Nasol is seeking Board approval of this recognition so that he could present the certificate to the award recipient at the April 13, 2015, BCAC awards ceremony.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a recognition certificate on behalf of the Board of Trustees to the Berryessa Citizens Advisory Council Citizen of the Year Award for 2014.
items.item_text: Board Recognition of Berryessa Citizens Advisory Council Citizen of the Year Award

items.item_text: Adoption of the Measure G Bond Programs Consent Agenda
items.item_text_raw: 1. Adoption of the Measure G Bond Programs Consent Agenda

items.item_details:
On May 9, 2012, the Board agreed to enter into a contract with Lionakis to perform architectural design, construction administration and closeout services for the Automotive Technology Building project at Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
Project Assignment Amendment No. 005 includes design, construction administration and closeout services for the addition of (5) relocated pathway lights along the fire lane between the Cedro and Automotive Technology buildings. Services include site / field reviews, revision of existing plans and specifications, review of RFI’s and submittals, field observation during construction, and punchlist / closeout activities. Lionakis submitted a written price proposal for this change that include additional work.  The proposal has been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
The previous PAA amendment increased the design value to be based on the final programmed project cost.  The item in the amendment results in an addition of the contact of $8,000.
	 
Original Contract Amount                  $668,350
Previous Approved Revisions            $324,995
This Revision No. 005                            $8,000
Total Contract and Changes           $1,001,345
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Revision No. 005 to Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) EVC-01 in the amount of $8,000 to Lionakis, for the Automotive Technology Building, Project #32111 at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Automotive Technology Building, Project #32111 - Lionakis Revision No. 005 to a Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) EVC-01.
items.item_text_raw: 2. Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Automotive Technology Building, Project #32111 - Lionakis Revision No. 005 to a Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) EVC-01.

items.item_details:
On November 11, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a contract to C. Overaa & Company in the amount of $11,347,704 to provide construction services for the Automotive Technology Building Project at Evergreen Valley College.  
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions or District requested design changes that require an adjustment to the contract scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 001 is for the extension of permanent power and data into the building, deletion of bid alternate #3 for vehicle storage parking, modification of concrete masonry block wall finishing, changing the building roof material to standing seam metal, and added fencing / signage along the construction haul route and neighborhood boundary for increased safety.      
	 
C. Overaa & Company submitted written pricing proposals for these changes (details in the Agenda attachment) that include the applicable increase or decrease in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions, and overhead and profit...  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                    $11,347,704
Previously Approved Changes                            $0
Change Order No. 001                             $277,476
Revised Contract Amount                    $11,625,180
	 
The net change to C. Overaa & Company's contract as a result of all changes issued is $277,476, which equates to 2.45% of the original contract.  This change will be funded from project contingency established in the project budget in expectation of this type of change.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 001 in the amount of $277,476 to C. Overaa & Company for the Automotive Technology Building Project at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Building, Project #32111 - C. Overaa & Company Change Order No. 001
items.item_text_raw: 3. Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Building, Project #32111 - C. Overaa & Company Change Order No. 001

items.item_details:
On February 25, 2013 the Board of Trustees agreed to enter into contract with URS Corporation to perform Geotechnical services for the Automotive Technology Project at Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
Note – The original ICA was with URS Corporation, which was purchased by AECOM.  This revision and all future ICA revisions will be with AECOM. 
	 
During the early stages of building excavation, unexpected organic material and soft soil was exposed under the footings.  Also, contaminated soil was uncovered under the fire lane.  Both of these conditions required additional excavation and imported soil, as well as lab analysis and reports before the existing material is sent to local landfill.  Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) Revision No.004 includes field exploration, geotechnical engineering analysis, and preparation of Geotechnical investigation reports.  AECOM (URS Corporation) submitted a written price proposal for changes that include additional work.  The proposal has been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
The previous ICA amendment increased the contract value to be based on the final programmed project cost.  The item in the amendment results in an addition of the contact of $35,945.
           
Original Contract Amount            $74,416
Previous Approved Revisions       $9,639
This Revision No. 004                 $35,945
Total Contract and Changes     $120,000
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) Revision No. 004 in the amount of $35,945 to AECOM (URS Corporation) for Geotechnical / Environmental Services to the Automotive Technology Building Project #32111 at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Building Project #32111, Geotechnical Environmental Services– AECOM (URS Corporation) Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) Revision No. 004
items.item_text_raw: 4. Measure G – 2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Building Project #32111, Geotechnical Environmental Services– AECOM (URS Corporation) Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA) Revision No. 004

items.item_details:
On March 11, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a contract to Kitchell CEM Inc. in the amount of $4,914,192.00 to provide construction services for San Jose City College. 
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions; District requested or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract, scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order. Change order No. 007 includes additional work to install finishes in the laser lab, receiving, installing, and powering on the instructional equipment the installation, additional framing work in buildings 100 and 200, and the infill of ceilings in two rooms.
	 
Kitchell CEM Inc. was also directed to oversee the installation of owner furnished lab equipment. The cost to perform this additional work (detailed in the attachment), includes the applicable increase in materials, equipment, labor, time extensions and overhead and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                $4,914,192.00
Previous Approved Changes           $   316,232.00
Change Order No. 007                    $   210,608.00
Total Contract and Changes            $5,441,032.00
	 
The net change to Kitchell CEM Inc. contract as a result of all changes issued is $526,840.00 which equates to 10.7% of the original contract.  This change will be funded from project contingency established in the project budget in expectation of this type of change.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 007 in the amount of $210,608.00 to Kitchell CEM Inc., for the Career Technical Education Buildings Project #31107-02, Buildings 100 & 200 at San Jose City College.

items.item_details:
On February 11, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a contract to Environmental Systems, Inc. in the amount of $276,000.00 to provide construction services  at San Jose City College. 
	 
Construction contracts commonly experience unforeseen conditions; District requested or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract, scope, price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 002 is for additional programming to the air handling unit for cooling stages, operation of the economizer, fan speed, chilled water valve modulation and the morning warm up cycle for classrooms. 
	 
Environmental Systems, Inc. submitted written pricing proposals for these changes (detailed in the attachment) that include the applicable adjustments to materials, equipment, labor, time extensions and overhead and profit.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                           $ 276,000.00
Previously Approved Changes                   $   (8,760.00)
Change Order No. 002                               $     1,371.00
	 
Revised Contract Amount                           $268,611.00
	 
The net change to Environmental Systems, Inc. contract as a result of all changes issued is ($7,389.00) which equates to (2.7%) of the original contract. This change will be funded from project contingency established in the project budget in expectation of this type of change.

items.item_details:
On September 14, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved an ICA to BMH Equipment, Inc., in the amount of $38,236.59 to provide equipment and installation services for the High Density Storage System at the New District Office Building .
	 
This ICA Revision No. 001, is for seismic engineering for a revised layout.  After the initial product submittal it was determined that a change in configuration would better suit the District’s needs. BMH Equipment, Inc. submitted written pricing proposals for changes that included this additional work.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure that the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
            Original Contract Amount                  $38,236.59
            Previous Approved Revisions           $           .00
            This Revision No. 001                       $  1,500.00
                 
            Total Contract and Changes             $39,736.59

items.item_details:
On October 14, 2014, the Board of Trustees approved a contract to Integrated Communications Systems, Inc. in the amount of $388,620.00 to provide construction services at the San Jose Evergreen Community College District. 
	 
Construction contracts often times experience unforeseen conditions, coordination gaps and/or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 002 is for additional inputs to allow more flexibility in the Board Room system, on-site support for the initial Board meetings and other miscellaneous changes.
	 
Integrated Communications Systems, Inc. submitted written pricing proposals for changes (detailed in the attachment) that include additional materials, equipment, and labor as applicable and the prescribed mark-ups.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.

Previously Approved Changes             $       3,891.00
Change Order No. 002                         $     24,969.00
	 
Revised Contract Amount                    $   417,480.00
	 
The net change to Integrated Communication Systems, Inc.’s contract as a result of all changes issued is $28,860.00 which equates to 7% of the base contract. This change will be funded from project contingency.  No additional funding is required.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 002 in the amount of $24,969.00 to Integrated Communications Systems, Inc. for the New District Office Building Project #39301, Audio Visual System at the San Jose Evergreen Community College District.

items.item_details:
On October 8, 2013, the Board of Trustees approved a contract to XL Construction in the amount of $6,100,000 to provide construction services for the San Jose Evergreen Community College District. 
	 
Construction contracts often times experience unforeseen conditions, coordination gaps and/or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order No. 007 is for owner directed changes as well as changes resulting from unforeseen conditions.  Including, additional fire alarm devices, roof drain repair, permit fees, AV infrastructure upgrades, and deductive change order for an unused signage allowance.  
	 
XL Construction submitted written pricing proposals for changes (detailed in the attachment) that include additional or deleted materials, equipment, labor, time extensions as applicable and the prescribed mark-ups.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
Original Contract Amount                     $6,100,000.00
Previously Approved Changes             $   992,455.00
Change Order No. 007                         $     33,550.00
	 
Revised Contract Amount                    $7,126,005.00
	 
The net change to XL Construction contract as a result of all changes issued is $1,026,005 which equates to 16.8% of the base contract. This change will be funded from project contingency.  No additional funding is required.

items.item_details: The Board of Trustees adopted the District's operating budget at its meeting of September 9, 2014.  As required by Board Policy 6250, subsequent budget transfers and revisions must be approved by the Board of Trustees.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the resolution authorizing the budget transfers and revisions of funds within expenditure accounts, authorizing the appropriation of the receipt of unanticipated revenues in certain programs, and authorizing the reversal of appropriations in certain programs due to the non-receipt of program revenues.
items.item_text: Resolution Number 031015-1 Approving District Budget Transfers and Revisions
items.item_text_raw: 1. Resolution Number 031015-1 Approving District Budget Transfers and Revisions

items.item_details: This request represents an approval for the increase to the California Department of Education contract (CCTR-4284) and resolution #31015-3.  The contract was previously approved on July 8, 2014.  The increase will allow San Jose City College to pay St. Elizabeth's Day Home in full for all services rendered in the 2014-2015 fiscal year.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation to the Board of Trustees to approve resolution #31015-3 and the amendment to the California Department of Education contract (CCTR-4284), for the 2014-2015 fiscal year. The amended contract will increase from $155,534 to $164,424, a net increase of $8,890.
items.item_text: Acceptance of resolution #31015-3 and Amendment to the 2014-2015 California Department of Education contract (CCTR-4284)
items.item_text_raw: 2. Acceptance of resolution #31015-3 and Amendment to the 2014-2015 California Department of Education contract (CCTR-4284)

items.item_details:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees of the San José-Evergreen Community College District approves a resolution in support of Women’s History Month, March 2015.  The District appreciates the many women students, faculty, staff and administrators who have made numerous contributions of great value to our Colleges. The District also appreciates many members within the District community who have contributed to and/or participated in the educational and celebration events in March that pay tribute to Women’s History Month, 2015.  Members of the organizing groups include:
 
EVC
	Banerjee, Sravani
Blackman, Shelley
	Clark, Marjorie (Chair)
Fray, Karen 
Hahn, Robin
Kahn-Lomax, Charlie
Lazo, Rachel
	Lujan, Lori
Montelongo, Virginia
Rahim, Nasreen
	Roohi, Vora
Salak, Robin
Wambach, Nancy 
Warner, Sterling
 
SJCC
Blair, Michelle
Breheny, Jessica
Gregor, Michelle
Diversity Advisory Committee
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approves Resolution No. 031015-4 in support of Women's History Month
items.item_text: Resolution No. 031015-4 in Support of Women's History Month
items.item_text_raw: 3. Resolution No. 031015-4 in Support of Women's History Month

items.item_details:
As part of the accountability measures for the Measure G-2010 Bond Program, the management team for the program has put into place a formal process for managing, tracking and presenting to the Board of Trustees all revisions to the Measure G-2010 individual project names, scopes and budgets.  This process adheres to the accountability standards outlined by Proposition 39 and provides transparency in the evolution of the project list.
	 
Bond List Revision No. 12 includes the following revisions:  interest earnings allocations, budget and scope adjustments to San Jose City College projects, creation of one new project at San Jose City College and one new project at Evergreen Valley College.
	 
Please refer to the attached Bond List Revision Approval Request report and the Summary of Current Changes report for details on each project revision included on the G-2010 Bond List Revision No. 12 dated March 10, 2015.
	 
These Bond List Revisions have been approved by the San Jose City College and Evergreen Valley College Vice Presidents of Administrative Services and the Vice Chancellor of Administrative Services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees review and approve the revisions to the Measure G - 2010 bond list, as presented.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Bond List Revision No. 12
items.item_text_raw: 4. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Bond List Revision No. 12

items.item_details:
As part of the accountability measures for the Measure G-2004 Bond Program, the management team for the program has put into place a formal process for managing, tracking and presenting to the Board of Trustees all revisions to the Measure G-2004 individual project names, scopes and budgets.  This process adheres to the accountability standards outlined by Proposition 39 and provides transparency in the evolution of the project list.
	 
This Bond List Revision request includes interest earnings allocations as well as minor budget adjustments for Division of the State Architect and other close out items.
	 
Please refer to the attached Bond List Revision Approval Request report and the Summary of Current Changes report for details on each project revision included on the G-2004 Bond List Revision dated March 10, 2015.
	 
These Bond List Revisions have been approved by the San Jose City College and Evergreen Valley College Vice Presidents of Administrative Services and the Vice Chancellor of Administrative Services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees review and approve the revisions to the Measure G - 2004 bond list, as presented.

items.item_details:
On July 3, 2014, EVC’s President Yong and SJCC's Interim President Breland received a letter from the Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges (ACCJC) regarding the actions of the Commission at its meetings of June 4-6, 2014.   The Commission took action to impose Probation on Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College to continue on its Probation status.  The letter, requested that a follow up report be submitted by March 15, 2015, to address specific compliance with Eligibility Requirement 21 and Standard III.A.1c that reads as follows:
	 
 “Faculty and others directly responsible for student progress toward achieving stated student learning outcomes have, as a component of their evaluation, effectiveness in producing those learning outcomes.”
	 
 1. Our April 22, 2014 Accreditation Follow-Up Report indicated that we utilize a three-year pilot program between the FA, AFT 6157 (Union) and the San Jose Evergreen Community College District (District) regarding the recommendations of the Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges (ACCJC) that Student Learning Outcomes (SLO’s) be a component of faculty evaluations was not deemed by the Commissioners as meeting the Standard.  As the District and Union were not currently involved in negotiations, this pilot program was not a contract proposal. The three-year pilot program was an interim measure designed for the limited purposes of addressing the ACCJC’s requirements until the issues addressed in the pilot program was are negotiated between the District and the Union. The District and the Union agreed to the pilot program being in effect from Fall 2014 through Spring 2017 to coincide with the faculty evaluation cycle.
	 
2. Academic Administrators - Board Approval of Consent Agenda  Item F-7 of April 8, 2014 – “Revisions to Academic Administrator Job Descriptions and Performance Appraisal Form to Address Responsibility for the Systematic Assessment of Student Progress and Learning Outcomes” and the proposed evaluation form.  
	 
3. At the February 10, 2015 Governing Board meeting a recommendation was made that the Board of Trustees approve the District and Federation of Teachers, AFT 6157 tentative agreements.  And as part of that agreement a component to assess Student Learning Outcomes has been added to the faculty evaluation process, Article 19, 19a – 22.  This officially eliminates the three-year pilot program referenced in item #1 above and addresses the compliance with Standard III.A.1c. and Eligibility Requirement 21 (Integrity in Relations with the Accrediting Commission.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Accreditation Follow-Up Report for Evergreen Valley College in compliance with ACCJC's Request (Standard III.A.1.c and Eligibility Requirement 21)
items.item_text: ACCJC Follow-Up Report for Evergreen Valley College; submitted for final approval
items.item_text_raw: 9. ACCJC Follow-Up Report for Evergreen Valley College; submitted for final approval

items.item_details:
On July 3, 2014, San Jose City College's (SJCC) President Breland received a letter from the Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges (ACCJC) regarding the actions of the Commission at its meetings of June 4--6, 2014. The Commission took action to impose Probation on SJCC to continue on its Probation status. The letter requested that a follow-up report be submitted by March 15, 2015 to address specific compliance with Eligibility Requirement 21 and Standard III.A.1.c. It reads as follows:
	 
Faculty and others directly responsible for student progress toward achieving stated student learning outcomes have, as a component of their evaluation, effectiveness in producing those learning outcomes.
	 
1. Our April 22, 2014 Accreditation Follow-up Report indicated that we utilize a three-year pilot program between the FA, AFT 6157 (Union), and the San Jose Evergreen Community College District (District) regarding the recommendations of the ACCJC that Student Learning Outcomes (SLOs) be a component of faculty evaluations was not deemed by the Commissioners as meeting the Standard. As the District and Union were not currently involved in negotiations, this pilot program was not a contract proposal. The three-year pilot program was an interim measure designed for the limited purposes of addressing the ACCJCs requirements until the issues addressed in the pilot program are negotiated between the District and the Union. The District and the Union agreed to the pilot program effective fall 2014 through spring 2017 to coincide with the faculty evaluation cycle.
	 
2. Academic Administrators - Board Approval of Consent Agenda Item F-7 of April 8, 2014--"Revisions to Academic Administrator Job Descriptions and Performance Appraisal Form to Address Responsibility for the Systematic Assessment of Student Progress and Learning Outcomes" and the proposed evaluation form.
	 
3. At the February 10, 2015 Governing Board meeting a recommendation was made that the Board of Trustees approve the District and Federation of Teachers, AFT 6157, tentative agreements. As part of that agreement a component to assess SLOs has been added to the faculty evaluation process, Article 19, 19.a--22. This officially eliminates the three-year pilot program reference in item #1 above and addresses compliance with Standard III.A.1.c and Eligibility Requirement 21 (Integrity in Relations with the Accrediting Commission).
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Accreditation Follow-up Report for San Jose City College in compliance with ACCJCs request (Standard III.A.1.c and Eligibility Requirement 21)
items.item_text: ACCJC Follow-up Report for San Jose City College; submitted for final approval
items.item_text_raw: 10. ACCJC Follow-up Report for San Jose City College; submitted for final approval

items.item_details: The Board has scheduled regular updates to the Ends Policy Dashboard through quarterly Monitoring Reports.  At this meeting, the Board will hear a presentation about the Global Ends Statement, which includes a detailed look at each of the six Global Ends Policies.  This first monitoring report will provide a foundation for what the Board can expect to see in subsequent reports, while drilling into the data that drive the monthly dashboard reports.  The goal of this presentation is to 1) share where District is in relation to the dashboard targets; 2) analyze the areas of strength and opportunities for improvement within each of the Global Ends Policies; and 3) set direction as to the areas of focus that should be the priority of the District as it relates to the Global Ends Policies.  The Global Ends Policy Monitoring Report can support the District in making data-informed decisions and to establish priorities for the allocation fiscal and human resources to meet the goals measured in the Board Ends Policies.
items.item_text: Board Ends Policy Monitoring Report #1: Global Ends Statement
items.item_text_raw: 1. Board Ends Policy Monitoring Report #1: Global Ends Statement

items.item_details: The District Facilities and Bond Program Management office is responsible for oversight of capital projects (local bond funded as well as other funding sources), building maintenance and repair, facility improvements, long range facility planning and space management/reporting to the State Chancellor's office.  This presentation will provide an update to the Board of Trustees, with a primary focus on the capital project management and planning activities.
items.item_text: District Facilities and Bond Program Management Overview
items.item_text_raw: 2. District Facilities and Bond Program Management Overview

items.item_details:
Per its adopted governing principles, the Board of Trustees will evaluate its performance at the end of each meeting.
	 
The Board will consider two items in discussing its evaluation:
	 
1.To ascertain the effectiveness of the meeting in attaining the advancement of the Board's Global Ends Policy.
	 
2.To ascertain the degree to which Trustees adhered to the Board adopted Governance Principle: Trustees Code of Conduct.
